definition: running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Excluding the effects of one-time gains, operating losses were pared 32 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 扣除一次性收益影響，該業務營運虧損縮減32%。

sentences.english: First, let me tell you that a trading plan is only useful if you foll …
sentences.chinese: 首先，讓我告訴你，如果你有用營運計劃只是輸後。

sentences.english: Description: Operates flights between Hong Kong and destinations in Mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 營運來往香港及中國內地航點的航班。

sentences.english: The eight immortals yangko, dragon-lion dance to the operating vitality.
sentences.chinese: 秧歌龍獅舞翩躚，營運活力賽八仙。

sentences.english: Make and follow the budget of the operating expenses and follow up the operating cost.
sentences.chinese: 制定和跟蹤預算的營業費用和跟蹤營運成本。

sentences.english: Moreover, a hygienic internal operation will minimize your fresh food loss.
sentences.chinese: 運用清潔的營運理念，降低生鮮食品的損耗率。

sentences.english: Many Hong Kong operators have gained a foothold in overseas Internet markets.
sentences.chinese: 不少香港營運商已在海外互聯網市場建立據點。

sentences.english: Operates flights between Hong Kong and destinations in Mainland China…
sentences.chinese: 營運來往香港及中國內地航點的航班。

sentences.english: Even future operating management of the paradise has also proposed on the preparatory agenda.
sentences.chinese: 甚至樂園未來的營運管理亦已提上籌備日程。

sentences.english: This should be what naval architects and ship operators go in for.
sentences.chinese: 這是船舶設計者和船舶營運者應該追求的目標。

sentences.english: Taxis in Madrid run for nearly 20 hours per day.
sentences.chinese: 馬德里的出租車每天幾乎要營運20個小時。

sentences.english: Most of the original village collective assets management and operation. Most of the original village collective assets management and operation.
sentences.chinese: 對原大都村集體資產進行管理及營運。

sentences.english: Department manager in an enterprise as "operation center".
sentences.chinese: “營運中心”企業的部門管理人員。

sentences.english: The Hong Kong Jockey Club has been designated to be the operator of soccer betting.
sentences.chinese: 香港賽馬會獲指定爲足球博彩的營運機構。

sentences.english: In charge of the Provincial Department of Communications with Feng Jianshen, mainly responsible for operation.
sentences.chinese: 與馮健身同志共同分管省交通廳，側重營運。

sentences.english: The car you took is suspected as operating unlawfully.
sentences.chinese: 您乘坐的這輛車涉嫌非法營運。

definition: to be in operation/to do business/(of train, bus etc) to be in service/operation/service
to engage in (business etc)/to run/to operate
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to exploit (a resource)/to open up (for development)/to develop
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
